html: A verse similar to Isaiah 29:7-8 —in which “the nations that amass to fight against Mount Zion” come away empty—this depicts Jehovah’s descent on the mount in a great display of power as he did anciently on Mount Sinai (cf. Exodus 19:16-20 ). When enemy herders or shepherds think to deal the death blow to Jehovah’s people by destroying his elect, Jehovah descends to wage war upon them (Isaiah 30:30-32; 64:1-3 ). While many may be “dismayed” by the enemy’s voice —the king of Assyria/Babylon—or “daunted” by his formidable forces, none can withstand the divine power of Jehovah.
